title: 820-00239 No Boot, liquid damaged
message:
Not much liquid residue on the board. Seems like came in most near display control connector of course. 

Some noticeable stuff in near u7100 at r7100, c7100. on other side of board around one side of u7220. Customer noted display started discoloring in one corner before it was shut down.

PPBUS G3H is 13V
ALL_SYS_PWRGD - 0V
PP5V_S4 shows voltage going to zero. Diode here to ground is .295V


From what I've seen here in forums this board CPU often gets overvoltage w/liquid damage. I don't want to waste a lot of time on this as it if it is low probability fix.

SOme quick things to check?

title: 820-00239 No Boot, liquid damaged
message:
Any liquid sign around pins 1 & 43 of J8500?
Compare diode mode readings on pins 1 & 3.

title: 820-00239 No Boot, liquid damaged
message:
J8500 looks clean on board and in cable connector. No sign of liquid or shorting on pins. Another shop tried drying it out for customer. They must've been in the mac because one of the cable pull tabs was missing. So I don't know if they cleaned the board connectors at all. I don't think so or I would think they would have seen residue in spots on the board.

Pin 1 diode= 0.264V
Pin 3 diode= 0.268V

Here is a summary of areas where there was liquid residue:
C/R7100/1
U7220
C7210 to C8006

title: 820-00239 No Boot, liquid damaged
message: Liquid signs on CPU power supply is not good at all; probably dead CPU now...

title: 820-00239 No Boot, liquid damaged
message: Yeah... that and the fact that the damn display controller is right in the direct path of potential liquid, I'm wondering if the display is any good either. SO keyboard is 99% chance of being toast. SOunds like CPU is 75% or more of being dead, any way to get a guess on display?

title: 820-00239 No Boot, liquid damaged
message: Actual LCD assembly must be tested with known good board, if you want to know its state...

title: 820-00239 No Boot, liquid damaged
message:
I gave it one last poke around and noticed good voltage on
ALL_SYS_PWRGD & PP5V_S4
PUt it back in mac with one USB-C, display, one speaker and keyboard connected and get fan spin high. No display and no chime, no external display. If CPU fried still common to see basics work, correct?

title: 820-00239 No Boot, liquid damaged
message:
"ALL_SYS_PWRGD - 0V
PP5V_S4 shows voltage going to zero.
----------------------------
noticed good voltage on
ALL_SYS_PWRGD & PP5V_S4 "
What happened?
Do you get VCORE now?

title: 820-00239 No Boot, liquid damaged
message:
Not sure what happened... I had cleaned those areas... but thought had taken readings since cleaning. 

pp5v_so_vcore1= 5.16V

title: 820-00239 No Boot, liquid damaged
message: VCORE is the generic name for main CPU power rail; PPVCC_S0_CPU in this case...

title: 820-00239 No Boot, liquid damaged
message: When 1st powered on VCORE is 1.1V about 5secs after fans kick in (~10 seconds after power), it drops to 0.62V, at about 15secs from power on it pops to 1.1V but then immediately back to 0.62V and fans pick up speed to full on. It then holds at 0.62V

title: 820-00239 No Boot, liquid damaged
message:
0.62V looks good and mentioned changes are normal.
Seems that board is booting; check for USB activity...

title: 820-00239 No Boot, liquid damaged
message: It will supply power to usb-c with charger plugged in but as example flash drive light stays solid only.

title: 820-00239 No Boot, liquid damaged
message:
Voltage reactions on VCORE look like board boots.
Compare the other coils voltages with working board.

title: 820-00239 No Boot, liquid damaged
message: dah. don't have another working board for this to compare to...

title: 820-00239 No Boot, liquid damaged
message: Apart of AXG (GFX), you should get all other voltages for DDR, PCH, CPU...

title: 820-00239 No Boot, liquid damaged
message: I realized the reason this board later started was because the trackpad was unplugged. Doesn't start with trackpad plugged in. Does trackpad need to be good for this to POST/boot? I don't currently have another trackpad to try for this model, and had kind of thought this might be a lost cause but thought I'd give it one more go.

title: 820-00239 No Boot, liquid damaged
message: Check what happens disconnecting keyboard only (trackpad connected).

title: 820-00239 No Boot, liquid damaged
message: No it only seems to start with trackpad disconnected. keyboard/touch bar  can be connected or not. Touchbar doesn't show any activity, no usb activity detected. If board starts and I plug trackpad in after it started it will shut itself off after 30 plus seconds, and will start again as soon as I unplug the trackpad again.

title: 820-00239 No Boot, liquid damaged
message:
Compare diode mode readings (J4501) with good board.
Check all TPAD_SPI resistors.

SMC_LID is steady 3V with trackàd connected?

title: 820-00239 No Boot, liquid damaged
message:
I don't. have a good board to compare to unfortunately. SMC_Lid is steady 3V w TrackPad connected. It now starts with TP connected most of the time although one fan seems to be a bit wonky or slower than the other with the TPad connected. I tried reflashing the firmware a couple of times. When plugged into external display the display goes black. USB-C to external drive still not showing any data activity. With speaker plugged in and charger, I hear the chirp related to power from the speaker. CPU gets warm. It really does seem like it is trying to boot or partially booting.

Wondering if I should try SMC if I can source one? I had mostly written this one off but when I get time, I try a few things as it seems like there COULD be hope for this board.

title: 820-00239 No Boot, liquid damaged
message:
Liquid spill on these new boards is a nightmare.
So many small components and data lines density inside board high too.
